story: NewsBrexit: Theresa Mays team holding ongoing and signicant talks with DUPGavin Williamson is understood to be a key figure in negotiations with the hardline Northern Irish partyShareCommentsByMikey SmithPolitical Correspondent:,  MAR News "Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email Downing Street is desperately trying to win support for Theresa May’s Brexit deal this weekend ahead of a third “meaningful vote” on her pact.The DUP was today holding “ongoing and signicant discussions with Government” in a bid to smash the deadlock, a source said. Mrs May is in her Maidenhead, Berks, constituency tomorrow. But her spokeswoman said: “She’s been working tirelessly to deliver a deal and she will continue to do that.” The Mirror understands Defence Secretary Gavin Williamson could emerge as key figure in negotiations between No and the DUP, whose support is vitalthe PM is to push through her deal. As Mrs May’s Chief Whip, he struck a confidence-and-supply arrangement with the hardline Ulster party, and is thought to enjoy a good relationship with both their Westminster leader Nigel Dodds and overall chief Arlene Foster.   “They trust him and like him,” said one source. The Commons is expected to have another crunch showdown on Mrs May’s pact on Tuesday or Wednesday. The PM’s Withdrawal Agreement has been defeated twice already, by  votes in January and by  votes this week. Her hopes of striking “third time lucky” by winning over Eurosceptics and the DUP were dealt a fresh blow after the “Star Chamber” of Brexiteer lawyers rejected a further attempt to ease their fears about the Backstop, aimed at preventing ahrd border between Northern Ireland and the Republicthere is no future trade deal. Attorney General Geoffrey Cox torpedoed Mrs May’s plan last week when he judged Britain would be unable to exit the Backstop without permission.   It has since been suggested the UK could use the Vienna Convention - an international treaty laying down rules about treaties - to unilaterally pull out of the Backstop. But Star Chamber experts believe the bid is “badly misconceived”. Mrs May jets to Brussels on Thursday for an EU summit where she will beg bloc chiefs to delay Brexit beyond March , possibly until June . EU leaders could offer a longer extension. EU Council President Donald Tusk said: “I will appeal to the EU to be open to a long extensionthe UK finds it necessary to rethink its Brexit strategy and build consensus around it.” But European Parliament Brexit co-chief Guy Verhofstadt questioned why the leaders of the  should grant an extensionMrs May was “not ready for a cross-party approach to break the current deadlock” in the Commons.Shadow International Trade Secretary Barry Gardiner said Labour was pursuing cross-party discussions in the search for “something which can become the consensus that Parliament solidies around”.

title: moment brexit secretary urged mps
story: NewsThe moment the Brexit Secretary urged MPs to back delay - then voted against itTheresa May has repeatedly said a second referendum would threaten "the publics fragile trust in democracy"ShareCommentsByMikey SmithPolitical Correspondent:,  MAR Updated:,  MAR Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news politics video moment-stephen-barclay-said-it-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true""Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThis is the moment Brexit Secretary Stephen Barclay urged MPs to back a delay to Article  for the good of the country - before voting against it.Theresa May has repeatedly warned MPs that a second referendum on the terms of Brexit would threaten the publics fragile trust in democracy.Yet less than an hour after telling MPs it was in the national interest to push back the date of Britains departure from Europe, her top Brexit minister walked through the voting lobbies to oppose the move. And it wasnt even against the rules. Closing his speech to the House of Commons, Barclay: It is time for this house to act in the national interest. It’s time to put forward an extension that is realistic. I commend the motion put forward by the government to the house.   MPs voted - for the motion, which the PM was forced to lay after MPs rejected both her deal and No Deal this week. But she granted her MPs a free vote. Asked about Mr Barclays decision to urge MPs to vote for a motion second before he voted against it, the PMs spokesman said: “It was a free vote that the PM authorised.” So even though Mr Barclay was contradicting his own speech with his actions, he didnt break any rules and wont face disciplinary action. The motion makes the UK ask the EU for a delay no matter what, but thedepends on whether MPs back the Brexit deal in a third vote next week.   If Mrs May can persuade Tory Brexiteers and the DUP to finally back her, by threatening a huge delay and offering legal tweaks, then she will ask the EU for a delay until June . If she cannot agree a deal by next Wednesday, she will go to meet  EU leaders at a summit and Thursday and ask for a longer extension. Theresa Mays deputy David Lidington told BBC Radio s Today programme: It was a free vote in that ision yesterday. Now, what happens this morning is that the entire Cabinet has accepted the position that Parliament voted for last night. Ive been working very constructively with SteveBarclaysince his appointment a couple of months ago despite the fact that he and I were vigorously on opposite sides of the debate during the referendum, and we are continuing to work very constructively together today and in the days to come.  Mr Lidington said he believed that Leave-backing ministers had used the free vote as an opportunity to register how unhappy they were with being in the position where we dont really have an option as a country except to seek an extension of our time in the European Union. Mr Lidington said that leaving on March  with no deal remains the legal default position but the likelihood of it happening had diminished after this weeks votes. He said he was still hoping that the UK will leave as soon as possible in an orderly fashion by MPs backing Mrs Mays Withdrawal Agreement next week. Askeddefeat for the PMs deal might mean an extension of a year or more, Mr Lidington said: Those are the indications which the Brussels institutions of the EU - the Commission, the Council secretariat and certain member state governments - have been giving to us. He added: I hope that MPs of all parties will be over this weekend just reflecting on the way forward.

story: NewsBradley Lowerys dad gets incredible tattoo in tribute to the brave little boyBradley Lowery captured the hearts of the nation when he bravely fought childhood cancer neuroblastoma and struck up a special bond with footballer Jermain DefoeShareCommentsByBradley Jolly:,  MAR Updated:,  MAR NewsBradley Lowerys dad has had a tattoo done in tribute to the brave youngster"Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email This is the heartwarming tattoo Bradley Lowerys dad has had done in a touching tribute to the brave little boy.Carl Lowerys chest inking features a picture of Bradley wearing a Batman hat and his warm smile.The inspirational youngster stole the hearts of the nation as he bravely battled childhood cancer neuroblastoma. Bradley appeared as a mascot for his beloved Sunderland AFC and struck up a bond with their then striker Jermain Defoe. But the boy died aged just six on Friday July ,  .Speaking after having the tattoo done this week, Carl said: I miss Bradley every day, and wanted to do something as a tribute to him. I decided on a portrait on my chest so I always have him close to my heart.  Speaking to Sunderland Echo , he added: I am over the moon with the tattoo.The huge tattoo was designed by Lee Ganley, a tattoo artist from County Durham with more than  years experience. It took him around six hours to complete at his parlour, Buzzin Guns in Durham. The poignant writing on the inking reads: Your wings were ready, My heart was not. Lee, who has shared a photo of the tattoo on Instagram , also told Sunderland Echo: Im use to doing portraits and I do quite a lot of celebrity faces but there as something special about this.Theres definitely a little bit more pressure but it was a good photo and a good client. Carl was really happy with it. He just couldnt stop smiling. The picture is more fun and it shows Bradleys cheeky face. We looked at a few dferent pictures but his grin on this one stood out and the batman hat makes it a little more unique too. It was just an honour to do.Last year, Defoe got a tattoo in memory to Bradley , whom he called his best friend.  The striker, now on loan at Rangers from AFC Bournemouth, was Bradleys hero. Their precious bond began in September  when Sunderland hosted Everton in a Premier League clash at the Stadium of Light.And the former England forward was visibly emotional at the boys funeral .Following Bradleys passing, Defoe said: He was my best friend. He was genuine. He loved his football. He loved me and I loved him. There was nothing I could give him apart from just being a friend.

title: bride demanded refund lost flowers
story: NewsBride demanded refund for lost flowers - but florist saw them in wedding snapsFlorist co-owners Sarah Weatherill, , and Lisa Husband, , of wedding decor company Forever to Hold were allegedly scammed by a brideShareCommentsByLaura Forsyth:,  MAR Updated:,  MAR NewsFlorist co-owners Sarah Weatherill, , and Lisa Husband, , who were allegedly scammed "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A bride claimed a pound refund for wedding flowers that supposedly never arrived - only to be allegedly caught with the bouquet in social media photos.The recently married woman complained to mother and daughter-in-law-ran wedding decor company Forever to Hold for five months that the flowers never arrived. She was eventually refunded pound - despite the company Forever to Hold having proof of postage.Immediately after receiving the refund, co-owner Sarah Weatherill, , claims the woman blocked her and business partner Lisa Husband, , on Facebook .However a year later, Sarah was left in disbelief when she noticed the woman, from Port Glasgow, Scotland, had posted wedding pictures online with her clutching what appeared to be the exact articial flower bouquet in the snaps. After confronting her, Sarah was finally able to get the money back - but only after threatening to contact the police. She claimed that the flowers miraculously turned up at her neighbours in July - SEVEN MONTHS after they were sent.   Sarah, from Whitby, North Yorkshire, said: I was so shocked. I bet she thought shed never be found out but you cant hide anything anymore [with social media]. To us pound is a lot of money. But we refunded her because we wanted to keep our customer services reputation. We work so hard on our business - theres only me and Lisa and we very rarely get a wage from it. Theres so much out there in the news about businesses scamming brides, but Ive never heard of a bride who scams a business. We love what we do. Thats whats upset us more than anything. We cant believe what has happened. I didnt think anyone could ever do that. In January , Sarah and Lisa sent out the wedding bouquet as signed for delivery - around eight months before she tied the knot.   But after claiming she had never received the delivery, the bride started a five-month conversation about the missing flowers, with Sarah continuously contacting Royal Mail for updates. As soon as Sarah sent the refund cheque, she claims she vanished and was never heard from again. Sarah said: When were making bouquets we send photos to make sure everything is okay. We sent her flowers and she said she never received them. We were going to the Post Office and everything. In the end she said she wanted her money back. I came to the agreement with her because we wanted the business to do well so we sent her a full refund. All of a sudden she disappeared and shed blocked me. I said to Lisa go on your Facebook and seeyou can contact her and she couldnt, shed blocked her. Shed also blocked me husband. I thought something didnt add up, but I let it go because we were so busy. Last weekend [March ], Sarah was searching through old messages when she spotted Jordannes name and remembered the incident. Sarah said: I clicked on her profile and it wouldnt work, but her profile picture was her on her wedding day with her flowers [next to new hubby Sean].   I wasnt  per cent sure they were ours and needed more clarication. On the photos was the photo credit and I did a bit of investigation and messaged the photographer. I asked for more photos of the flowers for the wedding and the photographer sent some pictures over - they were  per cent our flowers. Ive looked back and theyve got exactly the same hessian wrapping on, exactly the same flowers, exactly the same style, exactly where we placed them. They are our flowers, because we keep photos of all the bouquets we send. I thought it was bizarre when she blocked us as soon as she got her money. After Sarah contacted f with her findings, she says the customer claimed she hadnt scammed them and the payment had simply gone over [her] head. Sarah refused Jordannes offer to repay the balance by pound per week and eventually she paid the pound back in full - after being told the incident would be reported to the police. Sarah said: I requested the payment in full or said I would take it further.   At first, she said she didnt have the funds and could pay pound a week. We said no and mentioned that we contact the police. Then she paid us back in full two days later. Sarah started making articial flower bouquets after making her own for her wedding and being inundated with requests from friends. But in , after having a heart attack, she was forced to quit her full-time job as a nanny and officially launched Forever to Hold with mother-in-law and business partner Lisa. Sarah said: When I started off I was just a normal business but weve built it up from scratch so quickly. It was crazy. I was working seven days a week and trying to do flowers. Then in August  I had a heart attack. I ended up in a hospital for over a week and I realised something had to give. I decided to go for it and thats when Lisa came on board. Since she came on board its gone crazy. The woman was contacted for comment but failed to respond. She appears to have since removed or deactivated her Facebook account.
